data.title: Privacy and legal notices
data.meta_description: AMC Bridge is a leading provider of software development services in the areas of computer aided design, engineering, manufacturing and construction.
data.text:
Personal information you give us:

We may collect, process, and keep the following kinds of personal data:

Information you share about your computer while using our website or clicking our ads, which includes: your IP address, geographical location, browser type and version, operating system, referral source, visit duration, page views and website navigation.

Information you provide when you apply for one of our published vacancies or if you choose to fill in a separate registration form (we receive your CV, name, and contact information).

Information you provide if you wish to subscribe to our email notifications and invitations to our online events (including your name and email address).

Information contained in or relating to any communication that you send to us or send through our website, share with us job boards or social media (including correspondence with us, some part of communication content, as well as all the associated metadata).

Information you place in our registration forms if you wish to participate in our online events – conferences and webinars (including your name and email address).

All types of feedback we give and receive from you (including all interview feedback).

Other personal information you choose to provide (emergency contacts, referrals, documents).

Personal information we get from third parties

We may also receive personal information about individuals from third parties. Such cases include receiving a CV you have published on a job board, getting a link to your profile in LinkedIn, or a recommendation of you as a potential candidate on a vacancy provided by another person or organization.

Consequences Of Not Providing Your Personal Data or Consent Withdrawal

You are not obliged to provide your Personal Data to us. However, as this information is required for us to provide you with our services or respond to your inquiries, we will not be able to offer some or any of our services without it.

You may withdraw your consent at any time with effect in the future.

The full amount of provided personal data will be kept as long as necessary for our cooperation or until the consent is revoked. When it happens, we will store only minimum data about you (full name, contact details, your CV, our references, and notes) to the extent justified by legitimate interest.

In case you wish to provide the least amount of information while visiting our website or sending a request using the correspondent form, it is possible to limit such information to the required fields (i.e., your name and email address.

Please note, that if you do not share any of your data with us, we will not be able to reach you to provide information or assistance on most questions you have for us. Moreover, if you decide to keep a very limited amount of personal data available for us on a long term, it may affect further communication steps (e.g., if you decide to apply for a job and join our team).

How Long We Keep Your Data

We only retain Personal Data for as long as is necessary. In retaining Personal Data, we consider:

The duration of the purposes that we collected it for, importantly the duration that we are obliged to provide the relevant services.

Fulfilling and managing our relationship with you.

We also retain Personal Data for the purposes of satisfying any legal, regulatory, accounting or reporting requirements and guidance.

Justification For Saving Your Data

5.1. Based on your consent:

When we gather your personal data:

We may process your IP address, geographical location, browser type and version, operating system, referral source, visit duration, page views and website navigation, log files using cookies and web beacons when you interact with our website, ads, and forms;

If you signed up as our subscriber or completed a registration form to participate in our events, you would receive the news on our updates and vacancies.

We also with your personal data to personalize this website and continue our marketing communication with you;

We may process your full name, contact details and your CV (which contains social media profiles, date of birth, education records, employment history, notice period at current employer, degrees, professional skills, interests, knowledge of foreign languages, salary expectations, relocation interests, family status, citizenship, certifications) when you apply for our vacancy;

The professional information you make public (e.g., you page on LinkedIn), when you communicate with us there;

Why we gather the information:

To conduct PR and marketing research;

To analyze our website visitors for improving the service;

To plan the next activities and prepare analytics;

To personalize communication with you and target our advertisement;

To ensure the effective the effectiveness of the recruitment process for all parties involved;

If you are no longer interested in the materials, you are free to inform us and cancel your subscription. In case you do not provide enough information for your successful recruitment, we may ask you to extend it.

5.2. Based on AMC Bridge legitimate interest:

When we gather your personal data:

We may process your full name, contact details, links to social media, position, employer, professional experience, gender, comments you left, photos and videos (to the extent permitted by law) when you participate or have plans to participate in our events;

We may also process this information when you contact us using our website or any external resources;

Some of your other personal data (e.g., feedback after the first interview) may be handed to other parties to make our communication precise (e.g., to share information on your performance during an interview with a customer);

We may gather and use your photos and video footage from our events (to the extent permitted by the law);

Why we gather the information:

To respond you and organize our communication (letters, phone calls, online or live meetings);

To inform you about the future activities you may find interesting;

To promote our company in ads;

When you give your consent, you enable us to record and store this information using specialized tools and CRM (Customer Relationship Management) systems.

Your Rights Relating to Your Personal Data

Under this Notice, you have the following rights:

Right to Access. This right enables you to request confirmation of whether we process personal data relating to you, and if so, to request a copy of that personal data. If such access cannot be granted in a decent period, AMC Bridge will set a deadline upon which the data will be provided.

Right to Rectification. This right enables you to request that we rectify or update any personal data that is inaccurate, incomplete, or outdated.

Right to Erasure. This right enables you to request that we erase your personal data in certain circumstances, such as if we collected personal data based on your consent, and you withdrew your consent later.

Right to Withdraw Consent. This right enables you to withdraw the consent you have given us to process your personal data. You may also request that we stop using your data for direct marketing purposes if it takes place.

Right to Restriction of Processing. This right enables you to request that we restrict the use of your personal data in certain circumstances, such as while we consider another request that you have submitted, for example, a request that we update your personal data.

Right to Data Portability. This right enables you to request that we provide a copy of your personal data to you in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format in certain circumstances.

You also have a right to request additional details on the following points: the purposes of the processing, categories of personal data available, who else might acquire your personal data outside AMC Bridge, what was the source of the information we acquired and how long it will be stored.

If you wish to execute any of these rights, please contact our DPO. Please be aware that we may ask you to enter your personal data to ensure that the requested information is not disclosed to the wrong person.

We recommend exercising your rights wisely and note that abuse of rights may affect your liability. You also have a right to lodge a complaint with data protection authorities.

Disclosing and transferring personal data

We do not sell, trade, or rent Users' personal information to third parties without the User's consent and only in the cases specified above. We may share anonymized, aggregated User information with our business partners, trusted affiliates, and advertisers for the purposes noted above. We may use third-party service providers to help us operate our business, manage the site, or administer activities on our behalf, such as distributing newsletters or surveys. We notify Users about transferring personal data to third parties in registration forms or other promotional materials.

We may disclose your personal information to any or all our subsidiaries and affiliates.

Your personal data may also be disclosed for the following reasons:

if we are required to do so by law to a certain extent.

in relation to any ongoing or prospective legal processes.

to establish, exercise or defend our legal rights.

We may transfer Personal Data outside the EU. We will ensure that the Personal Data is protected by appropriate safeguards, such safeguards include at least one of the followings:

The destination country has been deemed to provide an adequate level of protection for Personal Data by the European Commission.

The service provider is bound by relevant and specific contractual obligations required under applicable data protection laws.

Some parts of your personal data like your CV or interview feedbacks can be handed to other parties (technical interviewers, PMs, directors) only if it is required by the process.

Business relations, based on AMC Bridge legitimate interest:

If you represent our current or potential client, vendor, business partner or investor, the following personal data may be processed: your full name, contact information, current and previous positions in corresponding companies, activities related to sales, all our recorded communication with you with feedback and reports on such communication, data on your current position and publicly available personal information. We need it to maintain proper business communication with AMC Bridge, engage a new business with the company you represent and share updates, organize the approval, processing and signing of contracts, acts and invoices, provide confirmation on the quality of our service.

Additional notes for our applicants

In case you intend to give us personal information of a third party (e.g., your teacher/team leader/supervisor who shared a reference about your performance) you are obligated to ensure that person knows about it.

Before you provide us with a recommendation of another person, you must obtain that person's consent and give us documented evidence. This information will be checked by us. To do so, you should share the email of the referred person, so we could share this message:

Please give your consent to the transfer of your personal data such as: your full name, contact details, location, publicly available professional information, reference, education records, certifications, salary expectations and your CV to be recommended as a candidate for one of the vacancies published by AMC Bridge, Inc.

The data controller of the filing system, in which your personal data is stored and processed will be AMC Bridge, Inc.

If you have questions, you may contact the Data Protection Officer by this email – This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.. The data controller will treat your personal data as confidential and will only process such information in compliance with GDPR regulations. The team members in HR and internal departments of AMC Bridge in the countries of presence have access to the systems where your data will be safely kept, but they will process your personal data only for the purposes of organizing and maintaining the recruitment and further employment processes.

Your personal data will be kept until the consent is revoked, unless otherwise prescribed by applicable legal requirements or if it is necessary for further processing.

You have the right to control the amount of provided personal data and you can ask to make corrections/updates to it. You may also restrict and object to data processing as soon as you find it necessary. If you do not wish us to use the information which has been provided to us any longer, please inform the DPO with a correspondent notification.

I give my consent to process and store my personal data:

Signature.

Please note that we will use your personal data as well to identify you and give a referral bonus.

Please make sure that This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it. is in CC.

Retaining personal data

Your personal data is stored by AMC Bridge on its servers, and on the servers of the cloud-based database management services as well as CRM systems and other tools.

Personal data that we are processing based on your consent will be kept until the consent is revoked, unless it is necessary for legal reasons described in the previous chapters.

When our communication ends, we may keep some part of your personal data (full name, a CV, references, contact information and feedback on your performance) until the consent is revoked.

Security of personal data

To help protect the privacy of data and personally identifiable information you share with us, we provide physical, technical, and administrative safeguards.

We update, test, and strengthen our security measures on a regular basis. Access to your personal data is limited to those employees who are responsible for communication and provision of benefits and services for you. Our team members are regularly educated and consulted on our cyber security and data privacy rules and their further updates.

In case of any issues, we will notify you and put all our efforts into eliminating all possible risks to your personal data, even if it takes place because of the third party (services used for processing).

Further updates

AMC Bridge may update this Policy at any time and without any more notice. By using the Site and our online resources, data subjects acknowledge and agree that it is their responsibility to review this Notice periodically.

As GDPR regulations, all related laws and legal interpretations of the main terms change, this Notice will be updated as well. We reserve the right to make updates and alterations to this agreement at any time. The dates for further alterations of this Notice will also be given here.

Third party links and references

Our websites, social media pages and notifications may include links and details of third-party resources.

Although we may share them, we are not responsible for the ways they arrange and implement data privacy rights, so visit them and use them at your own responsibility.

About cookies

Our Site may use "cookies": files placed on Users' computers for information tracking and record-keeping purposes – to enhance users’ experience. Users may choose to set their web browser to refuse cookies or to alert them when cookies are being sent. However, if a cookie is not placed on the User's computer, some parts of the Site may not function properly.

As described in the chapters given above, our websites collect information automatically and it is later kept in log files. It involves the following: IP addresses, devices’ geographic locations, browser type, operating system, referral source, visit duration, page views and website navigation Your IP address may also be used to diagnose problems with our server, administer this website, conduct PR and marketing research, and collect demographic information to understand your preferences and needs better.
